title: 114_hr108
content: There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so the curr_chunk cannot be summarized. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code, terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, stopping further contributions and deductions from their basic pay. This does not affect any existing rights or benefits under this subchapter. Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, halting contributions from their pay. This does not impact existing rights or benefits. Additionally, eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan remains unaffected. Regulations for implementation are to be determined by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under Section 8335a of Title 5, United States Code. This does not affect existing rights or benefits, and Thrift Savings Plan eligibility remains unchanged. Implementation regulations will be determined by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under Section 8425a of Title 5, United States Code. No further Government contributions or deductions from basic pay may be made for Members after a certain period or completion of 5 years of service. After ceasing to be subject to this chapter, deductions from basic pay for Members of Congress may be made for deposit in the Treasury of the United States. Individuals who become Members after a certain date are not subject to this chapter, and no Government contributions or deductions from basic pay are made for them. This does not affect any existing rights, entitlements, or benefits under this chapter for Members. After ceasing to be subject to this chapter, deductions from basic pay for Members of Congress may be made for deposit in the Treasury of the United States. Individuals who become Members after a certain date are not subject to this chapter, and no Government contributions or deductions from basic pay are made for them. This does not affect any existing rights, entitlements, or benefits under this chapter for Members. The eligibility of a Member to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan is not affected by the changes in subsection (a). Regulations necessary to carry out this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director for matters relating to the Thrift Savings Plan. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
